logic

Class QImageProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.QImageProcessor

  • public class QImageProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for gluing images together, and more image manipulation stuff.

      • constructHorizontal

                                               java.awt.image.BufferedImage right)
        Will attach both images side by side.

        Returns:

      • extractImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage extractImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                        int x,
                                        int y,
                                        int width,
                                        int height)
        Extracts a given part from a given image.
        Parameters:
        image - Image from which you would like to extract a part.
        x - the x coordinate of the newly extracted image.
        y - the y coordinate of the newly extracted image within the given image.
        width - The width of the newly extracted image.
        height - The height of the newly extracted image.
        Returns:
        The extracted image that you desired.

      • flipVertically

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage flipVertically(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Flips the image around its y axis.
        Parameters:
        image - The image that you want flipped.
        Returns:
        The new image that is a copy of given image flipped around its y axis.

      • flipHorizontally

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage flipHorizontally(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Flips the image around its x axis.
        Parameters:
        image - The image that you want flipped.
        Returns:
        The new image that is a copy of given image flipped around its x axis.

      • resize

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage resize(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                  int width,
                                  int height)
        Resizes image to the specified width and height. The original image is not touched so you are safe.
        Parameters:
        image - The image you want resized.
        width - The new width of the image.
        height - The new height of the image.
        Returns:
        Newly resized image.
